intro: Diplotaxis cretacea, commonly known as the Cretan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has serrated, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Diplotaxis cretacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
